projects.name: Currency Converter
projects.description: Proficient in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with a focus on creating responsive and user-friendly interfaces that enhance the user experience. Leveraged these skills to design a currency converter that is both functional and easy to navigate. Developed a dynamic currency converter that interacts with real-time exchange rate APIs, allowing users to seamlessly convert currencies. The project includes features such as form validation, responsive design for various devices, and a smooth user experience for converting and displaying currency values.

projects.name: Bank Management System
projects.description: Developed a C++ bank management system with features including account creation, deposits, withdrawals, and balance checks, utilizing file handling for persistent data storage. Employed arrays and file streams to efficiently manage user data and transactions, ensuring a seamless and reliable user experience through a command-line interface.

projects.name: Parkinsons Disease detection
projects.description: Developed a Parkinsons disease detection model using SVM with remarkable performance metrics: 95% accuracy, 94% precision, and 92% recall. These results highlight its potential for early diagnosis, crucial for timely intervention and treatment enhancement. Implemented feature engineering and SVM classification techniques, contributing to significant advancements in medical technology. Outperformed alternative models like Logistic Regression and Decision Trees, showcasing the SVM models robustness in Parkinsons disease diagnosis.

experiences.description: Engaged in an 8-week virtual internship program focused on developing Salesforce applications and understanding its ecosystem. Participated in online instructor-led hands-on Bootcamps, gaining practical experience in Salesforce development. Developing interview soft skills through exclusive soft skills training sessions.
